download.description: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink

href.description: Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to

hreflang.description: Specifies the language of the linked document

media.description: Specifies what media/device the linked document is optimized for

ping.description:
Specifies a space-separated list of URLs to which, when the link is 
    followed, post requests with the body ping will be sent by the browser (in 
    the background). Typically used for tracking.

referrerpolicy.description: Specifies which referrer information to send with the link

rel.description: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document

target.description: Specifies where to open the linked document

type.description: Specifies the media type of the linked document

alt.description: Specifies an alternate text for the area. Required if the href attribute is present

coords.description: Specifies the coordinates of the area

download.description: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink

href.description: Specifies the hyperlink target for the area

hreflang.description: Specifies the language of the target URL

media.description: Specifies what media/device the target URL is optimized for

referrerpolicy.description: Specifies which referrer information to send with the link

rel.description: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the target URL

shape.description: Specifies the shape of the area

target.description: Specifies where to open the target URL

type.description: Specifies the media type of the target URL

href.description: Specifies the base URL for all relative URLs in the page

target.description: Specifies the default target for all hyperlinks and forms in the page

dir.description: Required. Specifies the text direction of the text inside the <bdo> element

cite.description: Specifies the source of the quotation

autofocus.description: Specifies that a button should automatically get focus when the page loads

disabled.description: Specifies that a button should be disabled

form.description: Specifies which form the button belongs to

formaction.description: Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted. Only for type="submit"

formenctype.description: Specifies how form-data should be encoded before sending it to a server. Only for type="submit"

formmethod.description: Specifies how to send the form-data (which HTTP method to use). Only for type="submit"

formnovalidate.description: Specifies that the form-data should not be validated on submission. Only for type="submit"

formtarget.description: Specifies where to display the response after submitting the form. Only for type="submit"

name.description: Specifies a name for the button

value.description: Specifies an initial value for the button

height.description: Specifies the height of the canvas. Default value is 150

width.description: Specifies the width of the canvas Default value is 300

value: Defines sample output from a computer program

span.description: Specifies the number of columns a <col> element should span
Specifies the number of columns a column group should span

value.description: Specifies the machine-readable translation of the content of the element

cite.description: Specifies a URL to a document that explains the reason why the text was deleted/changed

datetime.description: Specifies the date and time of when the text was deleted/changed

open.description: Specifies that the details should be visible (open) to the user
Specifies that the dialog element is active and that the user can interact with it

height.description: Specifies the height of the embedded content

src.description: Specifies the address of the external file to embed

type.description: Specifies the media type of the embedded content

width.description: Specifies the width of the embedded content

disabled.description: Specifies that a group of related form elements should be disabled

form.description: Specifies which form the fieldset belongs to

name.description: Specifies a name for the fieldset

accept-charset.description: Specifies the character encodings that are to be used for the form submission

action.description: Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted

autocomplete.description: Specifies whether a form should have autocomplete on or off

enctype.description: Specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (only for method="post")

method.description: Specifies the HTTP method to use when sending form-data

name.description: Specifies the name of a form

novalidate.description: Specifies that the form should not be validated when submitted

rel.description:
Specifies the relationship between a linked resource and the current 
    document

target.description: Specifies where to display the response that is received after submitting the form

xmlns.description: Specifies the XML namespace attribute (If you need your content to conform to XHTML)

allow.description: Specifies a feature policy for the <iframe>

allowfullscreen.description:
Set to true if the <iframe> can activate fullscreen mode by calling the 
    requestFullscreen() method

allowpaymentrequest.description:
Set to true if a cross-origin <iframe> should be allowed to invoke the 
    Payment Request API

height.description: Specifies the height of an <iframe>. Default height is 150 pixels

loading.description:
Specifies whether a browser should load an iframe immediately or to 
    defer loading of iframes until some conditions are met

referrerpolicy.description:
Specifies which referrer information to send when 
    fetching the iframe

sandbox.description: Enables an extra set of restrictions for the content in an <iframe>

src.description: Specifies the address of the document to embed in the <iframe>

srcdoc.description: Specifies the HTML content of the page to show in the <iframe>

width.description: Specifies the width of an <iframe>. Default width is 300 pixels

alt.description: Specifies an alternate text for an image

crossorigin.description: Allow images from third-party sites that allow cross-origin access to be used with canvas

height.description: Specifies the height of an image

ismap.description: Specifies an image as a server-side image map

loading.description:
Specifies whether a browser should load an image immediately or to defer 
    loading of images until some conditions are met

longdesc.description: Specifies a URL to a detailed description of an image

referrerpolicy.description: Specifies which referrer information to use when fetching an image

sizes.description: Specifies image sizes for different page layouts

src.description: Specifies the path to the image

srcset.description: Specifies a list of image files to use in different situations

usemap.description: Specifies an image as a client-side image map

width.description: Specifies the width of an image

accept.description:
Specifies a filter for what file types the user can pick from the file 
    input dialog box (only for type="file")

alt.description: Specifies an alternate text for images (only for type="image")

autocomplete.description: Specifies whether an <input> element should have autocomplete enabled

autofocus.description: Specifies that an <input> element should automatically get focus when the page loads

checked.description: Specifies that an <input> element should be pre-selected when the page loads (for type="checkbox" or type="radio")

dirname.description: Specifies that the text direction will be submitted

disabled.description: Specifies that an <input> element should be disabled

form.description: Specifies the form the <input> element belongs to

formaction.description: Specifies the URL of the file that will process the input control when the form is submitted (for type="submit" and type="image")

formenctype.description: Specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (for type="submit" and type="image")

formmethod.description: Defines the HTTP method for sending data to the action URL (for type="submit" and type="image")

formnovalidate.description: Defines that form elements should not be validated when submitted

formtarget.description: Specifies where to display the response that is received after submitting the form (for type="submit" and type="image")

height.description: Specifies the height of an <input> element (only for type="image")

list.description: Refers to a <datalist> element that contains pre-defined options for an <input> element

max.description: Specifies the maximum value for an <input> element

maxlength.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an <input> element

min.description: Specifies a minimum value for an <input> element

minlength.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters required in an <input> element

multiple.description: Specifies that a user can enter more than one value in an <input> element

name.description: Specifies the name of an <input> element

pattern.description: Specifies a regular expression that an <input> element's value is checked against

placeholder.description: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an <input> element

readonly.description: Specifies that an input field is read-only

required.description: Specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form

size.description: Specifies the width, in characters, of an <input> element

src.description:
Specifies the URL of the image to use as a submit button (only for 
    type="image")

step.description: Specifies the interval between legal numbers in an input field

type.description: Specifies the type <input> element to display

value.description: Specifies the value of an <input> element

width.description: Specifies the width of an <input> element (only for type="image")

cite.description: Specifies a URL to a document that explains the reason why the text was inserted/changed

datetime.description: Specifies the date and time when the text was inserted/changed

value: Defines a piece of computer code
Defines sample output from a computer program

for.description: Specifies the id of the form element the label should be bound to

form.description: Specifies which form the label belongs to

value.description:
Only for <ol> lists. Specifies the start value of a list item. The 
    following list items will increment from that number

crossorigin.description: Specifies how the element handles cross-origin requests

href.description: Specifies the location of the linked document

hreflang.description: Specifies the language of the text in the linked document

media.description: Specifies on what device the linked document will be displayed

referrerpolicy.description: Specifies which referrer to use when fetching the resource

rel.description: Required. Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document

sizes.description: Specifies the size of the linked resource. Only for rel="icon"

title.description: Defines a preferred or an alternate stylesheet

type.description: Specifies the media type of the linked document

name.description: Required. Specifies the name of the image map

charset.description: Specifies the character encoding for the HTML document

content.description: Specifies the value associated with the http-equiv or name attribute

http-equiv.description: Provides an HTTP header for the information/value of the content attribute

name.description: Specifies a name for the metadata

form.description: Specifies which form the <meter> element belongs to

high.description: Specifies the range that is considered to be a high value

low.description: Specifies the range that is considered to be a low value

max.description: Specifies the maximum value of the range

min.description: Specifies the minimum value of the range. Default value is 0

optimum.description: Specifies what value is the optimal value for the gauge

value.description: Required. Specifies the current value of the gauge

data.description: Specifies the URL of the resource to be used by the object

form.description: Specifies which form the object belongs to

height.description: Specifies the height of the object

name.description: Specifies a name for the object

type.description: Specifies the media type of data specified in the data attribute

typemustmatch.description:
Specifies whether the type attribute and the actual content of the 
    resource must match to be displayed

usemap.description: Specifies the name of a client-side image map to be used with the object

width.description: Specifies the width of the object

reversed.description: Specifies that the list order should be reversed (9,8,7...)

start.description: Specifies the start value of an ordered list

type.description: Specifies the kind of marker to use in the list

disabled.description: Specifies that an option-group should be disabled

label.description: Specifies a label for an option-group

disabled.description: Specifies that an option should be disabled

label.description: Specifies a shorter label for an option

selected.description: Specifies that an option should be pre-selected when the page loads

value.description: Specifies the value to be sent to a server

for.description: Specifies the relationship between the result of the calculation, and the elements used in the calculation

form.description: Specifies which form the output element belongs to

name.description: Specifies a name for the output element
Specifies the name of a parameter

value.description: Specifies the value of the parameter

value: Defines a piece of computer code
Defines sample output from a computer program

max.description: Specifies how much work the task requires in total. Default value is 1

value.description: Specifies how much of the task has been completed

cite.description: Specifies the source URL of the quote

value: Defines a piece of computer code

async.description:
Specifies that the script is downloaded in parallel to parsing the page, 
    and executed as soon as it is available (before parsing completes) (only for external scripts)

crossorigin.description: Sets the mode of the request to an HTTP CORS Request

defer.description:
Specifies that the script is downloaded in parallel to parsing the page, 
    and executed after the page has finished parsing (only for external scripts)

integrity.description:
Allows a browser to check the fetched script to ensure that the code is 
    never loaded if the source has been manipulated

nomodule.description:
Specifies that the script should not be executed in browsers supporting
    ES2015 modules

referrerpolicy.description: Specifies which referrer information to send when fetching a script

src.description: Specifies the URL of an external script file

type.description: Specifies the media type of the script

autofocus.description: Specifies that the drop-down list should automatically get focus when the page loads

disabled.description: Specifies that a drop-down list should be disabled

form.description: Defines which form the drop-down list belongs to

multiple.description: Specifies that multiple options can be selected at once

name.description: Defines a name for the drop-down list

required.description: Specifies that the user is required to select a value before submitting the form

size.description: Defines the number of visible options in a drop-down list

media.description: Accepts any valid media query that would normally be defined in a CSS

sizes.description: Specifies image sizes for different page layouts

src.description: Required when <source> is used in <audio> and <video>. Specifies the URL of the media file

srcset.description:
Required when <source> is used in <picture>. Specifies the URL of the 
    image to use in different situations

type.description: Specifies the MIME-type of the resource

media.description: Specifies what media/device the media resource is optimized for

type.description: Specifies the media type of the <style> tag

colspan.description: Specifies the number of columns a cell should span

headers.description: Specifies one or more header cells a cell is related to

rowspan.description: Sets the number of rows a cell should span

autofocus.description: Specifies that a text area should automatically get focus when the page loads

cols.description: Specifies the visible width of a text area

dirname.description: Specifies that the text direction of the textarea will be submitted

disabled.description: Specifies that a text area should be disabled

form.description: Specifies which form the text area belongs to

maxlength.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in the text area

name.description: Specifies a name for a text area

placeholder.description: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of a text area

readonly.description: Specifies that a text area should be read-only

required.description: Specifies that a text area is required/must be filled out

rows.description: Specifies the visible number of lines in a text area

wrap.description: Specifies how the text in a text area is to be wrapped when submitted in a form

abbr.description: Specifies an abbreviated version of the content in a header cell

colspan.description: Specifies the number of columns a header cell should span

headers.description: Specifies one or more header cells a cell is related to

rowspan.description: Specifies the number of rows a header cell should span

scope.description: Specifies whether a header cell is a header for a column, row, or group of columns or rows

datetime.description: Represent a machine-readable format of the <time> element

default.description: Specifies that the track is to be enabled if the user's preferences do not indicate that another track would be more appropriate

kind.description: Specifies the kind of text track

label.description: Specifies the title of the text track

src.description: Required. Specifies the URL of the track file

srclang.description: Specifies the language of the track text data (required if kind="subtitles")

value: Defines a piece of computer code
Defines sample output from a computer program
